main_definition: Originally, Kodak referred to the American-based multinational corporation known for its photographic products; nowadays it has become an idiomatic expression representing anything related to capturing moments or preserving memories.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The reference to a film camera manufacturer
meanings_and_examples.example: I'm still using my old Kodak camera from the 90s.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A moment or memory that is captured in a photograph
meanings_and_examples.example: That photo of us at the beach last summer will always be one of our Kodak moments.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to or denoting something that helps preserve memories or capture moments, similar to how a camera captures images
meanings_and_examples.example: We're looking for ways to digitally archive all the old family photos. This could be our Kodak solution.
